From 28-30 Aug, 3-5pm, treat yourself to any Venti-sized handcrafted drink and enjoy another on us. Available at all stores. T&Cs apply.

comments.message: Can't even taste the vanilla.
11 teaspoons of sugar ?!?!

Would appreciate it if you revise the pricing on the menu for the cold brew w vanilla sweet cream asap. Menu states $6.70 for venti but when keyed in it's $7.40. The baristas at Centrepoint weren't aware of the price discrepancy until I pointed it out when I received the receipt. By then the transaction had already gone through. I guess I would have known of the price difference had the cashier informed me before I paid but she simply told me to scan the barcode on my Starbucks app..

I am disappointed with the nitro cold brew with sweet cream. I was charged 7.20 for a venti and the coffee was sourish with a diluted milk taste that was neither creamy not sweet. Huge gap in expectations. Worse than Americano with milk.  Purchase was made at gopeng outlet next to international plaza. #starbucks

comments.message: Hi Starbucks, which store can buy this?

I went to get my passport holder from your ocean financial center branch yesterday. There is no display set available so I approached the cashier asked if there is any sample for us to touch and feel the material. The cashier just took over the box that I was holding and opened up for me to see. Then I asked if there is green color available as I could not find one from the shelf. The cashier just turned and asked his colleague. So someone brought me the green one and I decided to buy. The cashier asked me to pay $9.90. I was shock as I knew the passport holder is comes with a card and it costs $19.90. So I clarified with the cashier. Again, the cashier turned to check with his colleague and realised about this "offer". After making the payment, the cashier just passed the passport holder & the card. I need to ask him to pass me the receipt.

Do you notice something here? He never interact with his customer who standing in front of him for 5 minutes! He never apologised for making the mistake. He didn't bother to say thank you to his customer.

Very brilliant Starbucks on your front line staff training. 👍

Cut the crap Strabucks! I queued up at 4:47pm just now at Starbucks City Hall outlet only to hear that I can no longer avail since I was attended by your counter at 5:05pm. Was that my fault? There was a long queue. Next time when you advertise a promo or rewards be specific that we could only avail if we reach your counter before 5pm. Service sucks! Not customer-friendly neither apologies being raised at all for the confusion. I am even a regular Starbucks customer every week. How about give a 5pm reminder slip to the next customer who is in queue at 5:00pm sharp?! This will remind you that the customer you will serve next can avail of the promo regardless if have arrived at 4:59pm?! After all your promo ads has no specific T&C's mentioned about queue up timing. 

Nonetheless, here's a big shout out for a very good and consistent customer service experience with Starbucks Jurong Point outlet. The last time I queued up there for the promo and notified one of their staff as I reached there that I am on queue and it's 4:55pm already, the lady staff replied me with a smile that it is fine.

Hi Starbucks Sg, I just experienced the most disappointing Starbucks experience to date. Starbucks always had the chirpy, cheery and chill vibe that I’ve always enjoyed from time to time – I’ve always been in awe of how the culture and the vibe could be similar throughout the various branches, even though they were all different crew of various backgrounds. However, today being the first time I visited the outlet at E!Avenue, it was an unforgettable negative experience.

My friend and I wanted to order the ‘buy 3 cakes get 1 free’ set to share, and we were attended to by Jenny. Jenny wasn’t particularly patient with us when we were trying to decide which flavours to try out, but we didn’t mind it that much. But when we got to paying, Hafiz told us in a rather unfriendly tone that our oreo cheesecake didn’t qualify to be part of the deal. Well, we were disappointed with that outcome, but what was more disappointing was the fact that neither Jenny nor Hafiz bothered to apologise (especially when Jenny was there when we made our choices).
So my friend and I sat down, thankfully the environment here was clean – very much appreciated. At about 21:50 hours Jenny suddenly started to clear the tables next to us, and told us in an unfriendly tone that they were closing. Well – normally in food establishments when it was going to be closing time, the staff would notify us and give us about a 15 minutes heads up while we would wrap up our conversations etc.

The most appalling thing happened. Your staff at this branch – turned off the lights within 2 minutes of our conversation at 21:50 hours, leaving us in the dark (apparently trying to hint and force us to leave the premises). That didn’t have to happen because we knew it was going to be closing, just that 1. we weren’t given much time for heads up 2. That was just plain rude to turn off ALL the lights.

So please, Starbucks – as much as I love the chirpy vibes in generally most of your branches, please look into this as this isn’t the way to treat customers. I’d have got it if I was a bad and rude customer, demanding to overstay your closing time etc. But we weren’t. We were, treated in an unfriendly and rude manner for absolutely no reason at all. I really hope we get a satisfactory response to this matter. Thank you.

The above post was posted here on Starbucks Singapore wall last night but it has since disappeared mysteriously. I am reposting this to seek a response.

Visited the outlet at bugis on 2/8/17 and there was a longgg q for the 1 for 1. However,  very impressed w ur staff.  They were friendly,  smiley and v efficient.  Even w the crowd,  the drinks were ready within a few minutes!  Thumbups esp to one of your malay staff who was juggling order taking and helping the barista. 👍👍👍👍
Shiok!! True. But of a different kind. The 5 years of great customer service broken by bad service delivered and apathy. You guys don't just make Shiok drinks, but also deliver Shiok service now!!
